website_summaries.verdict: The perfect car-camping tent for the whole family complete with screened-in room.
pros: Setup can be completed by one adult if necessary
Made of water-repellent material with waterproof seams
Easy to get the tent back into the bag
cons: Heavy tent not designed for use on hiking trips

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, comfortable tent, very spacious, feels more like home. I love the possibility that you can do stargazing at night. Please, see the attached pictures.
customer_reviews.author: customerrr

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant!
customer_reviews.text: Rain leaks in horribly. Even though the description calls out how wonderfully waterproofed it is, Wenzel states that this tent was manufactured directly for Amazon and is not intended to be water resistant. Of course, we didn't know that until after it rained on us. It is a spacious tent and easy to put up, but only made for dry climates. We had water come through the bottom seams and all of the window seams. With the way that the window is made, the water will pool in the bottom between the screen and the flap so that it seeps in.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Never again. Tent is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst tent experience I’ve ever had in my entire life. I’m sooooooo disappointed!! This is only my first day having it up.... I have 2 more days to go. It will be raining every day. This tent leaks at the seems around the bottom of the tent, It’s leaking at the bottom seems of the inside door that splits the room from the porch.. I HATE WET SOCKS, and next to the side window there is a storage pocket... it’s leaking from underneath that. This is one leaky A$$ tent. Never again. This is probably why it’s sooo much cheaper then the other color.
customer_reviews.author: Israel

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is indeed roomy. I am glad that I followed the advice to set it up BEFORE going camping. It took a while to figure out how the pieces go together. But once I figured it out, it was just as fast as a two person tent my friends were using. However, I did need the assistance of another person. By my self it would have been a bit of a challenge. But if you are using a tent this large, surely you are not planning to sleep by yourself. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Tallrey

customer_reviews.title: This tent leaks.
customer_reviews.text: The seams on this tent are not water proof. The windows completely leak at the bottom seams and leaked in onto our cot. You can also see the water running down the back side of the tent coming in at the seams. Was going to try and contact the company for advice but do not see an option to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, but 3!!! zippers to close the front 'door' were a royal pain.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, but 3!!! zippers to close the front 'door' were a royal pain. Pretty much my only dislike of this tent is the fact that the front door has THREE zippers, which all come together at the bottom in the middle. IT IS NOT A SECURE CLOSURE. A snake or ants or rodents could easily get in. In addition, the two zippers along the bottom were difficult to close because they kept getting snagged on the little rain protector runner, which was impossible to keep out of the way. If you are easily annoyed and frustrated with stuff like this then get another tent.
customer_reviews.author: Winter Woods

customer_reviews.title: Thank the gods Amazon took it back and refunded my money on this piece of garbage. The experience soured me on anything else this ...
customer_reviews.text: Tent leaked at the seams around the floor and around windows. Spent several miserable days camping with my family in this sorry excuse for a tent. Thank the gods Amazon took it back and refunded my money on this piece of garbage. The experience soured me on anything else this company makes. DO NOT BUY IT
customer_reviews.author: Mike Zawacki

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good test of what it can handle
customer_reviews.text: Setup up this tent for the first time minutes before a severe thunderstorm warning hit. 25 mph wind gusts and total downpour. Not a drop of water got inside. The tent fabric shook in the wind, the upright tent poles did not budge. Pretty good test of what it can handle. I recommend a water proof spray for exposed seams once per year on any tent fyi.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Can't stand up to wind and cheaply made. :(
customer_reviews.text: I had such high expectations for this tent.. within 12 hours (and our FIRST time using it) we had a front pole break and the whole tent collapsed! The way the poles are set up is dumb. The tent is very big and you could definitely fit a lot of people but it doesn't stand up to the wind. Also the tent didn't come with set up instructions, we had to muscle through as best we could. Don't buy, find another tent. Really disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: I buy a lot of crap.

customer_reviews.title: Not A Good All weather tent
customer_reviews.text: We were very much looking forward to this tent being amazing and were unfortunately hugely let down. We took the tent on our annual camping trip and once the wind kicked in, it was all down hill. BE AWARE, THIS IS NOT a TAUT AND STURDY TENT for windy conditions. The poles were VERY flimsy and the blue cover isn't long enough nor taut enough to protect from high winds which caused tons of water to get inside the tent from all rain, especially the screen room because the windows don't zip horizontally at the top. Needless to say our belongings were soaked. Despite us using robe to try and secure the tent it just couldn't stand up to weather.
customer_reviews.author: Gem S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this tent again over Memorial day weekend. It's great. Sets up easy and pretty quick despite its large size. There is so much room inside especially with only two people and a dog. We had room for a queen sized air mattress, our packs, other gear and the dogs bed- and still had room to spare. I love the front "porch". We set up our chairs in there to keep away from the bugs and it was great. It may be too heavy to hike with, but if you camp near your vehicle, then I highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Boba Jeff

customer_reviews.title: making easy access for insects
customer_reviews.text: DON'T stake it down first...if you end up with too much tension around the seams they will tear. Definitely need a seam sealer and extra tarps/canopies if you're to experience "weather". We live outside in tents 4-6 months out of the year....this tent replaced our Coleman 8 person instant tent that endured last year's 4 month stint. I'm determined to make this one work for this year as I adore the design and extra space. The door/entrance is really my only issue. Very inconvenient tri-zipper that doesn't "seal closed"....leaves about a half-inch gap, making easy access for insects.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Jean Pope

customer_reviews.title: Klondike Tent Let down
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Klondike thinking that most of the bad reviews were too harsh but unfortunately, I was wrong. It was a true let down. First, we were never able to have a nice straight, properly stretched tent; did not matter how much we worked with it. We had water in our tent the first night. The zipper fly is so poorly made that it gets caught in the material all the time which will cause rips. I also wish the entry was as tall as the rest of the tent. I will not be purchasing this tent or any Wenzel product from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime G.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for wind or customer service
customer_reviews.text: Had some wind pick up while beach camping in California. The metal rods that have a designed bend in them, kinked flat and tore a hole in the tent. Could not rig the tent to stand after that and had to sleep in the back seat of my truck with my two-year-old. Customer service didn't care.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great tent but not for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING tent!!! Lots of space, I'd say it fits 4 adults in the big room or three twin mattresses very comfortably. We used the front room for Storage. It's easy to set up and fold, however it requires two people. Color is very nice. You don't want to use this tent on the cold weather or you will freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall not a bad tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall not a bad tent for the price. Withstood 3 days of constant downpour during my last camping trip with just minor drops of water on a few seams (didn't spray prior to setting up). Only con so far that I can see is that it's very hard to get the sides of the tent to remain fully taunt (unlike many of my old Coleman tents). This didn't reduce the interior space but does affect the look and raises issues about overall durability in the long run. The screened in front area is great during those mosquito infested late nights!
customer_reviews.author: Josh S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: What a perfect tent! Super spacious. Could easily fit a large family and kids comfortably or if you have animals the separate space in the front is nice. I surprised my hubby for our anniversary this weekend, and with not being able to go anywhere right now I decided to set up camp and decorate our backyard and make it feel like a little getaway for us. The tent held down nicely and it was very windy and it also sprinkled a tiny bit and we had no issues. This tent is worth the money! Would purchase again if I had to. Also come with 10 year warranty! How awesome is that.
customer_reviews.author: kevincunningham

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent a few months ago and I've taken it on 3 camping trips so far. Love it! It's super easy to set up. I'm female, about 5'6" and I can easily set it up by myself in 30 mins. or less. It's roomy, easily fits 2 fairly large cots, all of our gear, and 2 large dogs with beds. It's more than tall enough to be able to stand up in to get dressed and change clothes. The screened front area is great to get away from mosquitoes, yellow jackets, and rain. Tent is easy to take down and will actually fit back into the bag again!
customer_reviews.author: MSN

customer_reviews.title: Amazing  value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! Simple to put up, plenty of room (We have a queen inflatable in ours), plenty of porch space. We usually leave the rain fly off for better circulation, but took minutes to put it on when a storm was coming. It DOES go back into the bag it came in, just roll it correctly. I would highly recommend for couples, group of friends, or small families. Head vent might or not work, noy really sure, we are in GA...its bery humid and hot. When i first got it, I assembled it and waterproofed it with Coleman's spray as an extra protection.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent for a camping trip in Florida, and if you know anything about Florida you know it can rain out of nowhere and rain hard. It held up very nicely to the down pours. It was very easy to set up & take down, and it easily and comfortably accommodates three people with two blow up air mattresses. There's lots of room to stand without hitting your head on the ceiling and it also has very good ventilation. The ONLY issue we had was the front zipper snagging on the materiel, and that's not really a big deal. Overall this is a fantastic tent and I recommend it to anyone who wants to have room and feel cozy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It great for two adults and two children
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for family camping. It great for two adults and two children, I think eight would be a little crowded. I was able to erect the tent on my own with a little ingenuity but having two people makes it much easier. The only problem is if it is windy, make sure to secure it. The first time we used it in windy conditions the tent blew over. The pegs that came with the tent will not hold it down in moderate winds. I bought some good deep spiral pegs and have not had any further problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Took 40 mins to assemble. Bonus tent actually fits in bag
customer_reviews.text: Knocking a star off because the tent arrived with a small hole in the floor. A little bigger than a pen stab but smaller than a dime. Instead of returning I just put some duck tape down to cover the hole. The tent was otherwise undamaged. The floor does seem thinner than my coleman. Will put a tarp under this when we camp just to be extra safe. Took about 40 minutes to assemble the first time. Requires 2 people. I think we can get this down lower next time now that I know how the poles go. Remember with any tent you need to spray waterproofing stuff on the exposed seams. This will help with weatherproofing.
customer_reviews.author: TEXAS95

customer_reviews.title: Two tents in one
customer_reviews.text: I like this tent a lot. The manual states it will hold eight. I put a queen blowup bed and myself in it. You have room to stand up, no more crawling around on my knees. Put my chair and stereo in the gazebo area as I call it and make myself at home. The gazebo zips up at night or during the rain and it has a compete bottom, so you will not get wet. It does not like to be set up in the wind. If you do, get someone to help you. Use the tie downs! The tent has a tall profile and is subject to high wind, but properly tied down it is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Good Times

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space
customer_reviews.text: It's huge! The tent had plenty of room for a pack-and-play plus a queen size air mattress and enough room for me to walk around/get dressed standing (6'1''). Setup is pretty easy once you do it once or twice. Would highly recommend doing so BEFORE you go camping, just to be familiar with how it goes together. It did rain really hard in the morning and we did get some seeping through the seams, but for the amount of water it did not let in, I'll say it worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! So roomy..easy to put up. I love the screened in option for "porch" We use it to store most of our stuff separate from our sleeping area. My favorite part is the see through roof- if you are at the right campsite, the view of stars from your bed is unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: NMM1108

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: First set up was difficult because I was used to smaller tents. With a little help it went up. Lots of room. I have a queen size air bed that I use I upgrading it to a king because this tent is big enough. Haven't had it in the rain yet so that's still up in the air on how it does. COLD we camp at Ice House Reservoir in California and the temperatures there get in the 40's during late summer with a camp heater it's quite nice. During the day with windows open its like my bedroom. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wild child

customer_reviews.title: The Best Tent Ever
customer_reviews.text: We searched through reviews and decided on this tent. Best move we could have made. We were novice campers approaching retirement and were looking for something that would be roomy for us and could accommodate our grown kids and grand kids. This tent sets up easy and has great ventilation. We could fit two queen mattresses one in each room. It did great on literally our third night camping EVER by staying completely dry during a four hour rain event. I would change one thing on this tent by adding a double zipper to the entry allowing you bring the zipper from the top to meet the zipper at the bottom in the middle
customer_reviews.author: David Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with tent.
customer_reviews.text: Huge tent! Screen room great awesome. We have a queen and twin mattress in the back room with LOTS of extra room. I got carpet remnant from a box store pretty cheap. One for the back room and one for the front room. Highly recommend as it adds warmth and is a great floor! Good ventilation and dry. Can be setup by one person, however it's WAY easier with two.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth yorio

customer_reviews.title: Collapsed in 7 mph winds
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand how this has good reviews. Bought for a 4 day camping festival. If there’s any wind at all this tent will fall apart. One of the poles broke the first night we set it up, we had to duct tape another to prevent it from breaking. We spent the rest of the weekend fixing the tent because parts of it would collapse every time the wind blew. Don’t buy this unless you want to be woken up in the middle of the night because the tent collapsed on you.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: A portable cabin
customer_reviews.text: Heck, it's better than a tent, it's a portable cabin. Absolutely love it. You don't need a screen room anymore with this baby. We've used it 6 times with no issues at all, even in a few major thunderstorms with 45 mph wind gust. I'd thought I'd blow away but all was good, not one drip came in. I'd suggest you wax your door zipper to make it smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna-Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Tent failed and broke from small wind gust
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this tent!!! I had one and the first time I put it up it caught a little wind the steel poles turned a little and shattered the end of both fiberglass poles. I have been camping for over 40 years and never have seen a tent fail like this one did. I also noticed the tent had a few small holes in the floor and at one of the seems to the floor before it failed so it was going back for that also. I am just glad I checked it out before my camping trip. If your looking for a good quality well designed tent this is NOT THE TENT you want !!!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Mostly love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I love this tent. But it seems it may not provide as much ventilation as I'd hoped. But first things first. I put it up by myself twice so far. The first time my boyfriend read the directions (because it was a little confusing) while I put it together. The second time I was alone and it was much faster. Everything seems very durable. I love the space and everything else it advertises. But the ventilation will be a problem if it rains or there is a chance of rain i think. The rain fly does not come out far enough to keep the windows open. But there is a lot of potential if there is not bad weather.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Sara

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tent for the size and price.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome! There was plenty of room for 2 queen size air mattresses in the main compartment as room for 2 twin sized mattresses on the "porch". The tent was easy to assemble, 1 person could do it by themselves in a pinch, but because of the size of the tent, it's better two have 2 adults to assemble it. This tent held up well to several major downpours. The only reason water came in during the first downpour was because I had the windows unzipped. Cleaned that up, zipped up, and stayed completely dry during the following storms. I had no issues with the zippers getting caught, they worked flawlessly. I love my little palace!
customer_reviews.author: Twinmom+1

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The tent is definitely big. We go on a lot of camping trips and we were looking for something big, but easy to assemble - this tent did not disappoint. However, there are a few things that I would like improved: 1) it would be nice to have some hooks along the insides of the tent. 2) entrance space is a little too low compared to the entire tent. 3) Two-way zippers would make it easier to go in and out. Overall, it's a nice tent and definitely worth the money. Also, I noticed that the front zipper flap is kind of weird at the top. I wasn't sure if this was the actual design... Pictures included.
customer_reviews.author: Chin Cho

customer_reviews.title: Not good for high wind areas
customer_reviews.text: So I don't want to completely blame the tent, but the first outing with this tent, one of the tent stakes split down the middle. It was a very windy day in the mountains so perhaps some of that is on me for putting up such a high profile tent. Other than that, I loved the front porch area that we used for a card table and chairs setup. And I like the fact that there's a wall between that and the back area for sleep, so I can keep that closed while we play cards. Once I find a tent pole replacement, I might give this tent another chance...just in a more heavily wooded area protected from the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my son!! Would not stay standing!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was the worst purchase I have ever made on Amazon. We tent camp frequently and only bought a new tent because a mouse decided to eat our other. This tent cannot be put up by just one person and also no matter how many stakes we used we needed to reinforce with ropes at every pole just to get it to stand to put the rain fly on. While my 5 year old son was in the tent it collapsed and a pole hit him and left a mark on his forehead!!! We slept in the car and called Amazon immediately they are working with us to return the product however it ruined a wonderful family vacation!!!
customer_reviews.author: charles welton

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and Fun
customer_reviews.text: We have used this tent only once, in the mountains, with no rain (yet), for 3 nights. The main portion is tall enough to stand up, it's large enough for 2 cots plus middle aisle and 2 side aisles. The front portion is the screened porch. great area for changing after a shower, or putting on / taking off shoes. The extra little vent at the bottom of the main cabin helps draw in any airflow possible. It can be put up by one person, i'm sure. but certainly glad we had 2. Took about 30 minutes the first time we put it up and about 20 minutes to take down.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Husband hates it
customer_reviews.text: It's a large tent and perfect for sunny, perfect weather. That being said, if it rains you're going to have water in it. Every trip we've taken it on we have tried to get it tighter to keep water out. We have been unsuccessful. Not a good tent for beach camping either . Wind sent the tent poles in, caving the POS in. Coincidentally, on our last camping trip the people at the site next to us had a tent by the same brand and their tent poles were also blown in from wind.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so picky and paranoid about buying things I know nothing about online. I mean, I guess me and everyone else, right? Anyway, I read all the reviews and viewed photos of this and I promise this is one of the BEST purchases I've ever made. This was the first tent I've ever assembled (I use this term lightly as I'm sure there's another 'camping' word for this) and it was quick and easy. It's not a pop up tent but it's not far from being one. You can fit two king sized air mattresses in here and still be left with space for other camping items. 100% recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst tent cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Sad tent. Not easy to put together. Poles are very flimsy and loose. No instructions that are easily readable. Staking rings started ripping on the first use. Small gusts of wind will topple the tent down. Zippers do not even match up to make a complete closure. I have been camping for many years and this has to be the worst tent ever. If I would have known it was this bad I would have returned it for a refund. Please do not get this tent. The company needs to disclose how bad this product is.
customer_reviews.author: del

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say that I am not a die hard camper and I haven't camped in years. It took me a while to put together because it was so windy where we were camping. From the very beginning one of the poles in front wouldn't stand up straight and yes I know it was because of the wind. I tried all corners of this very large tent to trees surrounding us and it held up well. I think this is actually a great tent with a lot of ventilation. Didnt break in the winds we had.
customer_reviews.author: julie k

customer_reviews.title: Tent-Majal or Tajma-Tent
customer_reviews.text: We took our first big family camping trip and bought this tent for the occasion. After a trial set up before heading to the mountains we were able to put it up in about 7 minutes. We did receive static from others with smaller tents calling this the Tent-Majal or Tajma-Tent. The screened in porch was great to have with our crawling 8 month old. It kept him safe and kept us from having to hold him all weekend. I would highly recommend this tent, we cannot wait for our next family adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: It's big, easy to set up, and leaks like a seive.
customer_reviews.text: I've been tent camping all my life and had more tents than I can count. This is the first large cabin style tent I've had. It is very large inside and easy to set up. The problem is the floor tarp seals to the walls at the ground level. The seam is on the ground. We had a light steady rain on night one. Surrounded by trees and no wind. The rear vent literally had water running through it. Had to dry puddle after puddle the entire night. It maybe ok if you never plan on being inside of it in the rain. Currently boxing up for return...
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Not your friend in high winds
customer_reviews.text: This tent takes a while to set up. You need two people to get the rain fly on. It doesn’t stand up by itself, but needs to be staked down to stay up, unlike many dome tents. We camped with 30 mph gusts of wind, and had to use 2-3 guylines per pole on the wind side. We also had to add extra stakes, which we had to go buy, and keep hammering stakes back in as they pulled out of the ground. We are thinking of selling this and getting a different tent.
customer_reviews.author: Calamity

customer_reviews.title: Survived a storm
customer_reviews.text: Took the kids to their first camping trip. Went to a park near the beach and we had a pretty nasty storm come through. Pretty happy with the tent, it did not get one drop of water inside, so I'm finding it is well constructed, easy to setup and easy to put away. After we got home we opened it again to let it dry and air out. Can't find any fault with this tent, it did its job well.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Great, Roomy Tent
customer_reviews.text: Kinda heavy, but it's for car camping so no biggie. Pretty easy to put up & take down. Very roomy, love the front screened porch. Wish there was a screen on the door between the screened area & the main sleeping area, but it's not a deal breaker. I ordered the blue one, but received the red one. Again, not a deal breaker for me. It didn't rain or get very windy when we used it so can speak to water proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Lana C.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price we couldn't be happier with this purchase! Great for weekend camping. Lots of room, since I camp with a cat and a dog, it was nice for them to be able to move around. The material is thin,so I wouldn't recommend for extreme weather, but thrilled for my needs. Easy to put up and take down with mesh compartments inside, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: This is the second purchase of this exact model.
customer_reviews.text: When first purchased several years ago, after many uses, I believed this to be the "best" tent I had ever owned. After giving it away to a family member, they felt the same. I saw it on the Amazon site, and could not resist a re-purchase. Provided there has been no change in quality, material, and so on, I will keep it forever. This one is much prettier than the first, "blue vs gray". Thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Danny C.

customer_reviews.title: First night sleeping in it this weekend! Its huge ...
customer_reviews.text: First night sleeping in it this weekend! Its huge and it went up with my self and my husband in about 15 mins. And came down timed in 9m. 47 seconds. That is with 3 kids under 3 trying to "help"
customer_reviews.author: Tim Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: This tent is awesome! Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome ! Easy to set up. I'm 4'11 and I pretty much set it up myself in 20minutes you do need someone to go inside and hold up the middle but that's about it. Was pretty windy some nights and it held up well! The extra space in front was perfect for the late nights for everyone to just chill before we all head to bed. I recommend this tent!:)
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent! The screened front porch is amazing and I love that the bottom tarp going up a bit on the porch so to not let in any dirt/mud. Lots of large windows which add great ventilation! Love that this is large enough to stand in. The height of the porch is slightly shorter than the main portion of the tent but I was still stand upright in it since I'm short (5'3"), may be an issue for taller people! I used a waterproofing spray just to be safe. It has been rained on a bit and kept the water out but it has yet to be poured on!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Moreno

customer_reviews.title: will not keep the rain out !
customer_reviews.text: this is the worst tent i've owned. we used it once (and it was set up correctly) rain cover covering entire tent in anticipation of the rain. it rained so much water came through the side panels. Not through the mesh windows through the sides of the tent. terrible experience
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tent!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! There's tons of room. We set up both a queen size air mattress and a twin and there was room to spare in the sleeping area. The kids used the screen room to set up a table and play board games. Also let us bring our stuff inside the tent so we didn't have to leave it out in the rain. It also rained quite a bit on our camping trip and no leaks anywhere inside. Has huge windows and tall enough to stand up inside. Easy set up too!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Porch collapsed very first outing, splintered pole.
customer_reviews.text: Support pole that holds up the porch splintered the very first time I used the tent, and I spent the rest of my camping trip having to crawl out of the tent on my hands and knees, as the entire porch collapsed. Really disappointed as the porch feature was the key selling point for me.
customer_reviews.author: HungryMind

customer_reviews.title: Best tent!!
customer_reviews.text: Greatest tent we’ve ever bought!! It was very easy to set up and take down. The screened room was a lifesaver from mosquitoes!! Kids are grown up, so it was just us and dogs. We like a big tent for room. We had two queen blowups inside. It was perfect. Plenty of room to move around, change clothes, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jack.n.Emma.n.Ringo.too

customer_reviews.title: Great all around tent
customer_reviews.text: We have used this tent a few times now and set up takes up about 10 minutes. It seems like a flimsy tent at first, has some plastic connection pieces that are loose but ones it’s all set up it is a very sturdy tent. Very roomy. I didn’t think we would have this much room. We use the screen room as a storage room and the back to sleep in. I wish there was a back window and the room divider zipper is sewn in a really weird location. The ventilation in this tent is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The nice large size of the tent - my nephew and his family informed me which weekends they will need it, funny but he knows we will let them use it any time they want it. They will probably use it more than us(?). Going to use it for stay home vacations this year camp out in the yard and can hopefully invite family, friends and neighbors over for get- togethers : )
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't seem like this tent has the structural integrity to withstand any ...
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely a spacious tent and not really too hard to set up, but during our trip it was often windy and anytime there was a gust at all one of the poles would collapse in. We had to stack boxes inside the tent to keep it up and use weights on the outside to keep the stakes from being pulled out. It doesn't seem like this tent has the structural integrity to withstand any type of unfavorable weather.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Bebout

customer_reviews.title: The perfect CASTLE!
customer_reviews.text: Our fellow campers called THE CASTLE! Even though it says that it is for8 person, only 3 used and it was just enough space for them. The first room was used for all the gear and changed the dirty clothes and shoes, and the other room just to sleep. It took about half an hour to put together for the first time, after that it was much easier. Great purchase love the color perfect for beginner campers.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent
customer_reviews.text: We use this tent for a family of 4 and it is perfect. We set up a queen size bed on a frame in the main part and the kids sleep up front. I am 5'10" and I can stand in it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Bolin

customer_reviews.title: easy setup, good size
customer_reviews.text: I initially thought this was an instant up tent (it isn't), but it was still pretty easy to put up and didn't take too long. We did have some rain over the weekend and I didn't notice any leaks or issues. We were able to fit two queen air mattresses in the back area, it was tight width wise but there was a little room to walk between and room for storage length wise. overall happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Large tent. Not durable. Bad instructions.
customer_reviews.text: First, the instructions for this tent are pretty much garbage. Fortunately, set up is pretty intuitive. Although, I still don't know where the 5 plastic stakes go vs. the metal ones. The first night we used this tent the screen door ripped in 4 places. I have no idea how it ripped. We hardly used the door. I had to buy a patch kit.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome family tent!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think there’s anything I don’t like about this tent. I love the extra space on the front, nice for leaving your luggage, and sandy or dirty shoes in so it’s not in the sleeping area. We’re a family of 4 so our queen mattress and a sleeping bag fit perfectly with lots of room to spare. Made me wish I would’ve gotten a king mattress hah. I’m the type of camper that if where I’m sleeping doesn’t feel like home I’m probably not going to have a good time but this tent is beautiful and roomy so we had a wonderful time camping at Lake Michigan!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Well ventilated, large tent.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a good value and spacious. It’s not the easiest tent to erect, but manageable. Note, putting up the rain fly takes someone taller than 5’6”. We used ours first in very hot 100 degree weather. It had good ventilation with its large screened windows. Count on replacing the tent pegs with better ones.
customer_reviews.author: Marne MP

customer_reviews.title: Easy for One Person to put up
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research online before I purchased this tent. It was highly recommended as a larger tent that could be assembled by a single person. I was a bit skeptical at first, but it really is. It took me a couple of tries to figure it out completely and the trick to doing it, but you can actually put the tent up alone. I love the two rooms and the fact that I can have my queen mattress in the tent along with all of my equipment and a dog cage, and still stand up to put my jeans on!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. My first night using it i had set it up in my backyard and sprayed it for weather proofing. Also, i should add, I am not an avid camper. It was very easy to set up. Later that night there was a severe thunderstorm with strong winds. The tent stayed dry inside and it wasn't until 6 am that one side started collapsing. We stood it back up and went inside only to come out later that day to it standing perfectly. Used it while camping at parks twice since and had not had any problems. Very spacious! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: stormy brownrigg

customer_reviews.title: Looks better than it serves...
customer_reviews.text: Took in camping near the coastline this weekend... did not hold well to the wind... spent the night and the next day restaking the tent.... The flemsey little stakes the come with the tent are much to week alone... the wind was to strong for them to hold just the canopy down... used the nearby tree and park tables ... fortunately I had much stronger spikes from previous camping and used them to replace the supplies stakes ... The tires used to hold the tent to the frame tore away due the wind.. at night the interior walls of the tent would sweat ... Good thing this is my backup tent...
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Layout is amazing but construction could be better
customer_reviews.text: Although imloved the layout of the tent, there were a few issues. It must have previously been used because poles were dirty and scratched and some plastic stakes were missing. We had to use the metal stakes which were absolutely horrible!! They bent and when the wind blew they did not hold. Also, one of the loops broke right off. Luckily I’m not an avid camper or I’d be pissed!
customer_reviews.author: Minnie The Moochie

customer_reviews.title: Sealed, tested hard, leaked
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and layout. I carefully applied seem sealer to every seem prior to my first use. On the second night it was tested with a 5 inch rainstorm. The tent leaked beneath all of the zip up windows. Once it dried thoroughly, I applied more seem sealant in hopes that it will not leak again. Granted, the tent was truest tested with a deluge of rain but I feel compelled to share my experience with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lyon

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great in theory but is poorly constructed. There is little to no support to keep it standing, any gust of wind will blow this tent in. Don’t buy this tent if you are looking to camp on the lake/beach, we had to use 10 rebar stakes to keep it planted and even that couldn’t prevent it from caving in.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tent
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy and all pieces were accounted for. Nice air flow at night with the windows open. We had some heavy rainstorms over the course of a week and did not have any problems with leaks with the exception of the outermost door, which let in a very small amount of rain where the three zippers met. As with many tents, the outermost door also wanted to get snagged on itself unless unzipped in a specific manner. Otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: coloradobound

customer_reviews.title: Instructions not exactly clear
customer_reviews.text: Seemed that the instructions called for ground stakes that did not accompany the tent, however the breakdown said I received them all. Had to purchase additional stakes to hold it down correctly. Spacious and good in the weather, would buy again, but initial setup was hindered by the unclear directions. Also not easy to fold and fit back into carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tmil

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tent very large and definitely water proof we camped and all it did was rain the entire time so we were stuck in the tent a lot but we stayed dry. I did spray it with the weather shield before camping.
customer_reviews.author: B.Repich

customer_reviews.title: We set it up in the backyard and everything worked fine. A week later we went camping
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent for our first family camping trip. We set it up in the backyard and everything worked fine. A week later we went camping. We set up the tent and unzipped all the windows for air. Later that night, while getting ready to go to sleep we noticed that the zipper was missing on the two side windows in the front. We had to use clothes pins to hold the the cover over the screens. Which would have been fine if it hadn't rained. Be careful with the zippers on this tent. If you are buying it for the porch feel in the front, I would recommend a different tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, seams leak a little.
customer_reviews.text: Love how big it is and having the porch is great for not getting mud in the main room. The sides aren't taunt like a dome tent though and it leaked a bit in the seams. Hoping some waterproofing spray will help with that. But still a great tent for the price. It fit our big air mattress and still had room to walk around, was nice having the cabin style so we don't have to duck down near the sides like a dome tent.
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Very spacious
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very huge, as far as space I am pleased with the space it provides. You could easily put two queens in the back room I was only able to fit two twins in the front room All the rooms close up YOU WILL NEED EXTRA YELLOW STAKES The stakes that come with this are the weakest And they don’t come with a lot of yellow stakes This is not a pop up tent .
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective item and the seller ignored me. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: Loved this tent. My step-daughter set it all up by herself without even reading the instructions. Taking it down was just as easy. fits snug back in the bag but if your OCD im sure you can get it perfect. Very roomy, only complaint is that it lacks a net at its peak to set a lamp or lights. There is a small hook but if your lantern does not have a clip, well then I guess a shoe lace will suffice. In the end, super happy. Enjoyed our camping trip in this tent. Also, seems very durable to me. I know I should get at least 5 seasons of camping.
customer_reviews.author: POLO G.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy. Lose one elbow joint you're SOL
customer_reviews.text: Only use if you have a car close by you won't have to walk long distances with this. IT IS HEAVY. I fel bad for the kind bonnaroo group who helped me haul it to the closes open camp spot. In previous camping trips it did fine- pending you have someone to help you set it up. One MIGHT be able to do it by themselves. However without one plastic elbow joint missing, there is NO WAY to stand the tent up. The load on the joint is so heavy that you can't MCGyver it to work. Trying to find the replacement piece on the website was not successful
customer_reviews.author: Zach anderson

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Not water tight, even after I sprayed with sealant. The seems where the inside pockets hang from the wall leak, along with the vent on the backside of the tent. This tent also does not have a cord hole to the outside nor one between the two compartments making running cords impossible without 1. Cutting fabric and creating your own. 2. Leaving zipper open with cord going through. Pros: Easy to set up. Spacious and can stand straight up in the main room but not the forward room. (I’m 5’9”). There is a ring for a tent fan/light which was a bonus! And it looks very nice and breaths well. My tent is never hot which is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb mason Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. It kept me warm and dry in bad weather. The true test was one weekend on Lake Huron where the wind gusts were over 40 mph but the tent held its own. Kept me out of the wind and also dry in spite of rain and snow the first night. The only flaw is the time it takes to put together and tear down. It’s very complex.
customer_reviews.author: Akmfre

customer_reviews.title: Enormous tent - relatively easy up; tough to get back into its storage case
customer_reviews.text: I found the tent to be well constructed and pretty easy and intuitive to set up for the first time. It is huge; really huge. much bigger than I need, but for the price it cant be beat. The only issue causing this to be 4 our of 5 is that it is possible to fit the tent back into the storage bag it came with after setting it up, but it is not easy. It took me 4 tries at folding it different ways to barely stuff it back in (pay attention how you unfold it the first time - I didn't!). It should have come with a larger storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not stand up to the slightest breeze
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent for a trip to Michigan’s upper peninsula. About 10 minutes after laying down to sleep I heard a huge crash from our fan falling and one side of the tent was falling on me. The poles in the main dome do not hold up to even the slightest breeze and cause it to fold in (see pictures) This happened over and over again all night so needless to say we were very irritated by the time the sun came up. Unfortunately we have to ride it out until we get home from our trip but this tent will be returned immediately. Very unhappy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla VandeBunte

customer_reviews.title: Stayed dry in 2 days of driving rain!
customer_reviews.text: Went to Maine in September. Rained, hard, 2 out of 5 days. We stayed dry as a bone! I did spray the seams with weatherproofing prior to our trip. Easy enough to put up. I put it up by myself (my boyfriend was not helpful, as much as he tried). I highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: KimOneill

customer_reviews.title: Great, spacious, needs to be ancored well in high winds.
customer_reviews.text: Very spacious. Easy to put up (about 10 minutes). It is definitely a 2 person job though. We had a queen and twin air matresss with room to spare. The porch was a great area for our 2 year old's play area and our fold chairs. It rained and there weren't any leaks. We did weather proof it with 1 can when we first got it. I would give it 5 stars but the Texas wind knocked one side in a few times. Easy fix, no breaks but next time we will be anchoring it down a bit better. Oh and my husband is 6'4" and stood up in the main room with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Henson

customer_reviews.title: awesome !
customer_reviews.text: This item was an awesome first-timer tent purchase in part because of its ease to set up (although it does appear to require at least two people). Especially nice was that a full-size adult could stand up in the main part as well as the familiarity of the screen area for those of us who particularly enjoy 3-season rooms. Please note however that it may be prudent to purchase about 5 - 10 heavy duty stakes ( thick sturdy ) just to be on the safe side depending on the sort of terrain on which the tent is to be pitched. A ground-tarp was also purchased and strongly recommended to help prevent moisture from below.
customer_reviews.author: rufus Jones

customer_reviews.title: Set up/take down kind of a pain.
customer_reviews.text: I expected setting up and taking down would be time consuming.. but even with three of us it took about 30-45 minutes. It’s very spacious and the patio area is great for extra storage. It also helps keep the room clean. It held up against the rain too! Overall, I like it but wouldn’t buy again. Spend the money on one of those instant set up tents!
customer_reviews.author: K.C. Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tent as long as there is no wind or rain!
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't be more disappointed in this product. My Husband and I researched this tent and we're excited about our purchase and couldn't wait to use it. After having a hard time assembling it do to it being windy, our first night sleeping in it, it rained and leaked pretty good on one side of the tent onto our air mattress and blanket. I not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Keys

customer_reviews.title: Tent Camping Made Easy
customer_reviews.text: We have used our tent a couple of times now and love it!!! Plenty of room for a queen blow up mattress and a single blow up mattress in the main part of the tent. I love the floored front screened in area. It is a great place to keep our cooler and other items that we need during the day and keeps the clutter out of our sleeping area. It was so easy to put up. The last time we set up camp it was late and dark. We still had the tent up in about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: pattyf

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup - Tons of Room - Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Set it up in the sun no problem - screens are NOT water resistant - but it was a flash storm which filled the front room with water. Overall it stayed very dry int he main section. Wish it had a bit more flow through ventilation with the canopy on - but setting up a tent in an open field comes with consequence! I hope to get MANY years out of this tent - well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: J. Aaron

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Got to use the tent for the first time this weekend and it is fantastic! Easy set up and huge and sturdy! In the main part we could fit very comfortably 3 twin air matresses for the kids and in the Front part we put a queen air mattress for ourselves....there was still plenty of room the storage pockets were great. For people who have experience putting tents together it took us 15 minutes. It thunderstorms for about 3 hours not one single drip of water got in that tent and winds got high and stayed up like a champ! Great tent great price very satisfied! Exceeded our expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Habhab

customer_reviews.title: Pole broke and small leak
customer_reviews.text: One of the elastic strings in the long pole broke while we were setting up for the first time at camp. We were able to gerry-rig it with fishing line thank goodness. Leaked in one small spot in the front during thunderstorm. Other than that it was very roomy and comfy. If the manufacturer will replace the pole I wont have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: #1 Florida customer

customer_reviews.title: Even with seam sealing and waterproofing, still leaked badly in the rain. :(
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent for family camping with my wife and two young (2.5 and 4 yr old) children. We also purchased waterproofer and seam sealer and sealed this thing up tight the minute we received it. We let everything dry properly and then took it out camping a week or so later. While this tent is nice looking, big, and offers a lot of convenent features, unfortunately, even with all of the seam sealing and waterproofing we did, each point where a stake or pole was attached leaked very badly once the rain started falling. This got anything that was inside near the edge of the tent wet. :(
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORKING AS ADVERTISED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it but only use it twice. First time it collapsed at mid night when the wind kicked up 15 mph left us with young kids scared and cold all night. Last week tried it again hopping there was no wind but it was windy again... and didn't take long 16mph wind broke one of the structure members and collapsed the whole thing. We go stranded again. how dump was i. i need a refund!!!
customer_reviews.author: KTRAN

customer_reviews.title: Substandard
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing three stakes, AND with a hole in one corner, right above a peg loop, which is guaranteed to tear under tension. Very flimsy construction, sways badly in a very light breeze, and entire tent falls over if a single stake comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: best tent I have ever owned by far because it is so big! We camped in hana last weekend and we had a huge storm come through. It was raining sideways all night and the tent held up like a charm. This tent is WATERPROOF! U can open it up for stargazing and a cool day tent but if needed like we did u can button this up like a fortress. Wezel is a great company and I have had several of their tents which I have always been impressed
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent.
customer_reviews.text: Novice camper, first time use this weekend. Easy setup and take-down. Would give five stars if it had a second door on the big room, or at least a window, but we enjoyed it thoroughly. Can't beat the screen roofs - we didn't need to use the rain fly, and the view of the moon and stars was, well, heavenly.
customer_reviews.author: ktramazon

customer_reviews.title: I returned this tent
customer_reviews.text: After several hours of swearing and feeling like an idiot for not being able to set this thing up, we returned it to amazon. I wanted to love this tent. It looks like it would be awesome, but I couldn’t justify being so frustrated when on vacation. I bought a Coleman tent inseam from amazon and I love it. It took 20 minutes to set up.
customer_reviews.author: A Person on the Internet

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent about a month ago in preparation for a big camping trip. We decided to set up the tent to practice a few days before the trip. We opened the box and immediately noticed that the tent poles were all separated and not tied together. On further inspection, we realized the cord was dried out and already ripped on multiple segments. We are already a few days away from the trip have to hope the replacement cord we ordered comes in on time. Horrible product. DO NOT BUY THIS IT IS CHEAP AND YOU WILL REGRET IT.
customer_reviews.author: milton

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying this great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this tent, after reading MANY reviews and waiting until the price was right for me to buy it! Tent is exactly as described, looks as pictured, and not too difficult to set up or take down...plenty of room (I'm sure a mix of 8 adults/kids could sleep rather comfortably between the two separate "rooms") and every piece that came with it was quality and works as it should. Aside from possibly needing/using heavy duty stakes for camping on different types of terrain (though the included stakes do the job in soft, grassy, non-rocky situations) I have absolutely NO COMPLAINTS about this tent, and look forward to getting many years of use out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Butch'sDad

product_meta.title: Wenzel 8 Person Klondike Tent
product_meta.description: Great for camping with family or friends, the Wenzel Klondike measures 16-feet by 11-feet. The Klondike sleeps eight, five in its 98 square feet of interior space, with room for sleeping three more in the 60 square foot screen room with its zip up walls. 6.5 feet of head room lets you stand up straight while inside the tent. The attached screen room can also be used as sun shelter, a picnic room, a gear room or a room just to relax in. A full mesh roof and two mesh windows keep bugs out and let the breeze in. In addition a rear mesh vent creates ground breeze. Weather Armor polyester fabric with a polyurethane water resistant coating protects from top to bottom. Double-stitched, lap-felled seams through out the body of the tent provide a shingle effect against water. All threads, zippers and webbing are treated with superior water repellency applications to enforce these critical areas. The Klondike has a fiberglass frame and uses Power Corners that increase the tent's stability in high winds. Included are two hanging pockets that create an area for items needing easy access, a storage duffel and a 10 year warranty against defects. Specifications: • Base: 16 ft. x 11 ft. • Center Height: 78 in. • Eave Height: 61" • Area: 98 sq. ft. + 60 sq. ft. screen room • Door: Inverted "T" style, interior flex style • Floor: welded polyethylene • Frame: fiberglass • Stakes: steel and plastic • Carry Weight: 27.3 lbs. • Sleeps: 8
feature_bullets: Convertible screen room with inverted "T" style door and inside flap zippered windows
Mesh roof vents, 2 zippered side windows with inside flaps
Shock corded fiberglass roof frame with steel uprights and corner elbows combined with pin & ring for easy set up
Guy out vent at the back of the tent, Two convenience pockets

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
